metadata.title: Alaska Department of Fish & Game: Summary of the Mandatory Shellfish Observer Program Database

creators.name: Game (ADF&G), Division of Commercial Fisheries, Management

metadata.description: The observer program database contains information collected by biologist placed on board commercial crabbing vessels in the Bering Sea and the Aleutians.  The observer program was implemented in 1988 and continues to the present.  The database contains fishery efforts, catch abundance and composition profiles and species biological characteristics.  The database is updated annually.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Observers deployed on board commercial crabbing fishing vessels provide ADF&G with database of fishery statistics and species biological characteristics that provide insights to better fisheries management strategies and augment understanding of how the commercial fisheries may impact the Bering Sea ecosystem.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Continually

Access constraints: State of Alaska protects confidentiality of fisheries information linked to individual participants

Use constraints: State of Alaska protects confidentiality of fisheries information linked to individual participants
